poem:
Title: "In the Curls of Britannia's Song"

Oh British bulbs, twinkling on the tree of turmoil, 
Your glint, a hard love letter to sovereignty.
O Brexit, seasoned with regret & half-hearted cheer,
The gift Santa couldn't deliver on a silver sleigh.
Each wrapped pound screams in silence, a longing
For undone knots, for a Christmas once known.
Jingle it may, but the bell of economics echoes in sorrow.
